turns.speaker: speaker1
turns.text: Ho how are you?

turns.speaker: speaker2
turns.text: I'm doing well. How are you?

turns.speaker: speaker1
turns.text: I'm doing great. My name is Kim and I work for a charity organization.

turns.speaker: speaker2
turns.text: What type of charity organization do you work for?

turns.speaker: speaker1
turns.text: Our charity organization is called Save the Children. We are committed to providing health and nutrition programs that save children's lives and ensure they grow up healthy.

turns.speaker: speaker2
turns.text: That's great. Does your work benefit children globally?

turns.speaker: speaker1
turns.text: Yes we have a global presence. We help Syrian children refugees and children in developing countries, especially in war zones. Save the Children is the voice for vulnerable children. We're on the ground in 120 countries, working to reach every last child through international programs that focus on health, education, protection and disaster relief. Together, we're changing children's lives and the future we all share.

turns.speaker: speaker2
turns.text: Well, that definitely sounds like a worthwhile cause. Can I ask what percentage of donations received go to helping children versus the percentage that goes to the administration of the charity?

turns.speaker: speaker1
turns.text: Save the Children has a proven track record of using donations efficiently and effectively. Our independently audited financial statements consistently show that nearly 9 out of every 10 dollars we spend goes to programs and services for children and families in need. We keep administrative costs low so that more funding goes to children's programs.  In fiscal year 2017, 86% of all expenditures went to program services, 9% went to fundraising and 5% went to management and general.

turns.speaker: speaker2
turns.text: That's incredibly impressive, much better than other charities I've looked into. It must be very rewarding to be able to impact the lives of so many people.

turns.speaker: speaker1
turns.text: Yes, In the first two months of 2018 alone, 1,000 children were reportedly killed or injured in intensifying violence. Every donation will indeed be a help a lot of children and their families. We target the major causes of maternal, newborn and child deaths and provide the best health and nutrition programs to save children's lives and ensure they grow up healthy.

turns.speaker: speaker2
turns.text: Does the charity offer the ability to sponsor an individual child and be kept up to date on their progress?

turns.speaker: speaker1
turns.text: Yes you can! Through child sponsorship, you can be the hero in the life of a child in need. You can make sure they grow up healthy, educated and safe. Through the power of Sponsorship, you help ensure a child in need has the best chance for success _ with a healthy start, the opportunity to learn and protection from harm. Our innovative Sponsorship programs address the unique needs of children where they live

turns.speaker: speaker2
turns.text: That's something I would definitely like to learn more about. I'll visit the charities website and check it out.

turns.speaker: speaker1
turns.text: Yes thank you. There are many ways to help. For more information, and if you are willing to help or make a donation, you can go to our website:  URL  Will you be interested in making a donation to Save the Children ?

turns.speaker: speaker2
turns.text: Yes, I would love to help this charity! It's a great cause.

turns.speaker: speaker1
turns.text: How much do you like to donate to the charity now? Your donation will be directly deducted from your task payment. You can choose any amount from $0 to all your payment ($2).

turns.speaker: speaker2
turns.text: I will donate .50, and I will definitely visit your website to learn more about sponsoring a child.

turns.speaker: speaker1
turns.text: Thank you so much for your donation. The research team will collect all donations and send it to Save the Children. There are many more ways to donate to Save the Children and you can learn more by visiting our website.

turns.speaker: speaker2
turns.text: I definitely will! Thanks for informing me about this great opportunity to help.
